intro: Tithymalus cristatus, commonly known as the crowned tithymalus, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate flowers. It is native to southern Europe and western Asia, often found in rocky or limestone soils. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It is typically perennial and grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance and fragrant properties.
